org.jerkar.api.depmanagement

Class JkPublishRepo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkPublishRepo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class JkPublishRepo
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Stands for a repository for deploying artifacts.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JkPublishRepos and(JkPublishRepo repo)
      Returns a JkPublishRepos made of this JkPublishRepo and the specified one.
      JkPublishRepo andMd5Checksum()
      Returns a JkPublishRepo but adding the MD5 checksum algorithm.
      JkPublishRepos andRelease(JkRepo repo)
      Returns a JkPublishRepos made of this JkPublishRepo and the specified JkRepo for artifact having a non-snapshot version.
      JkPublishRepo andSha1Checksum()
      Same as andMd5Checksum() but with SHA-1 algo
      JkPublishRepo andSha1Md5Checksums()
      Returns a JkPublishRepo but with sha-1 and md5 check summers.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> checksumAlgorithms()
      Returns the algorithms used ("sha-1" or "md5") for check summing published artifacts.
      JkPublishFilter filter()
      Returns the filter used for this JkPublishRepo.
      static JkPublishRepo of(JkRepo jkRepo)
      Creates a JkPublishRepo for publishing always on the specified JkRepo.
      static JkPublishRepo of(JkRepo jkRepo, JkPublishFilter filter)
      Creates a JkPublishRepo for publishing on the specified JkRepo when the specified JkPublishRepo agree.
      static JkPublishRepo ofRelease(JkRepo jkRepo)
      Creates a JkPublishRepo for publishing non-snapshot version on the specified JkRepo.
      static JkPublishRepo ofSnapshot(JkRepo jkRepo)
      Creates a JkPublishRepo for publishing snapshot version on the specified JkRepo.
      JkPgp pgpSigner()
      If this repository requires a artifact PGP signature in order to be published, this method returns the the JkPgp signer for signing artifacts to be published.
      JkRepo repo()
      Returns the underlying JkRepo.
      boolean uniqueSnapshot()
      When true the snapshot version are replaced with a timestamped version (ala Maven 3) See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4275466/how-do-you-deal-with-maven-3- timestamped-snapshots-efficiently
      JkPublishRepo withSigner(JkPgp signer)
      Returns a JkPublishRepo identical to this one but with the specified Pgp signer.
      JkPublishRepo withUniqueSnapshot(boolean uniqueSnapShot)
      Returns a JkPublishRepo identical to this one but with the specified uniqueSnapshot property.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static JkPublishRepo of(JkRepo jkRepo,
                               JkPublishFilter filter)
        Creates a JkPublishRepo for publishing on the specified JkRepo when the specified JkPublishRepo agree. If the specified filter do not agree to publish a given JkVersionedModule, a publish of the disagreed module on this JkPublishRepo will result in an no operation (doing nothing).

      • of

        public static JkPublishRepo of(JkRepo jkRepo)
        Creates a JkPublishRepo for publishing always on the specified JkRepo.

      • ofSnapshot

        public static JkPublishRepo ofSnapshot(JkRepo jkRepo)
        Creates a JkPublishRepo for publishing snapshot version on the specified JkRepo. Release versions are not publishable on this JkPublishRepos

      • ofRelease

        public static JkPublishRepo ofRelease(JkRepo jkRepo)
        Creates a JkPublishRepo for publishing non-snapshot version on the specified JkRepo. Snapshot versions are not publishable on this JkPublishRepos

      • repo

        public JkRepo repo()
        Returns the underlying JkRepo.

      • filter

        public JkPublishFilter filter()
        Returns the filter used for this JkPublishRepo. Only modules accepted by this filter will pb published on this repo.

      • pgpSigner

        public JkPgp pgpSigner()
        If this repository requires a artifact PGP signature in order to be published, this method returns the the JkPgp signer for signing artifacts to be published. If no no PGP signer has been defined, this method returns null.

      • checksumAlgorithms

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> checksumAlgorithms()
        Returns the algorithms used ("sha-1" or "md5") for check summing published artifacts. If this, repository does not produces checksum, this methods returns an empty set.

      • uniqueSnapshot

        public boolean uniqueSnapshot()
        When true the snapshot version are replaced with a timestamped version (ala Maven 3) See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4275466/how-do-you-deal-with-maven-3- timestamped-snapshots-efficiently

      • withSigner

        public JkPublishRepo withSigner(JkPgp signer)
        Returns a JkPublishRepo identical to this one but with the specified Pgp signer. All artifacts published on the returned repository will be automatically signed with the specified Pgp signer, if this one is not null.

      • andMd5Checksum

        public JkPublishRepo andMd5Checksum()
        Returns a JkPublishRepo but adding the MD5 checksum algorithm. When adding a checksum algorith (as MD5 or SHA-1), all the published artifact will be hashed with the specified algorithms and the hashes will be published along the artifacts.

      • andSha1Checksum

        public JkPublishRepo andSha1Checksum()
        Same as andMd5Checksum() but with SHA-1 algo

      • andSha1Md5Checksums

        public JkPublishRepo andSha1Md5Checksums()
        Returns a JkPublishRepo but with sha-1 and md5 check summers. All published artifact will be check-summed with sha1 and md5.

      • and

        public JkPublishRepos and(JkPublishRepo repo)
        Returns a JkPublishRepos made of this JkPublishRepo and the specified one.

      • andRelease

        public JkPublishRepos andRelease(JkRepo repo)
        Returns a JkPublishRepos made of this JkPublishRepo and the specified JkRepo for artifact having a non-snapshot version.

      • withUniqueSnapshot

        public JkPublishRepo withUniqueSnapshot(boolean uniqueSnapShot)
        Returns a JkPublishRepo identical to this one but with the specified uniqueSnapshot property. When this property is truen artifact deployed on this repository are timestamped so several artifact from the same snapshot version can coexist in the this repository.
        This is the default behavior for artifact deployed with Maven 3, while this is not the case with Maven 2.
